summary: Email chain between FBI Special Agent (NY) and Mark L. Epstein discussing threats received by Mark Epstein, including a voicemail threatening his children. The FBI is investigating the source of threatening communications and coordinating with local police for safety.

persons.name: Mark L. Epstein
persons.context: He reports receiving threatening calls and a voicemail stating his children will die; he communicates with the FBI about his and his family's locations for safety.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent (NY)
persons.context: The FBI agent corresponds with Mark Epstein about the threats, requests addresses for safety patrols, and provides updates on tracing the threatening communications.

connections.description: The FBI agent is investigating threats made against Mark Epstein and his family, coordinating safety measures and updates.

events.title: Threatening voicemail left for Mark Epstein
events.description: Mark Epstein receives a voicemail at 3:16 AM from a caller with a heavy Indian accent threatening that his children will die.

events.title: FBI requests addresses for safety patrols
events.description: The FBI agent asks Mark Epstein for the addresses where his ex-wife, children, and he are staying to coordinate increased police patrols.

events.title: FBI traces threats to outside US
events.description: The FBI informs Mark Epstein that the threatening email and LinkedIn message originated from outside the United States.

keyFacts: Mark L. Epstein received threatening communications including a voicemail explicitly stating 'your children will die'.
The FBI determined the threatening email and LinkedIn message originated from outside the United States.
The FBI coordinated with local police to increase patrols near the locations of Mark Epstein's ex-wife and children as a safety precaution.
This document shows ongoing law enforcement involvement in threats against Mark Epstein in May 2020.
